Ad Text:
About Us

You may not have heard of Bapcor, but you will know our brands. We’re Asia Pacific's leading provider of vehicle parts, accessories, equipment, service and solutions and – through our businesses like Burson, Autobarn, Midas, Truckline and Baxters – are inside cars, on four-wheel drives and all over trucks.

In joining our team, you’ll be welcomed into a supportive business that spans more than 1,000 locations with over 5,000 team members across Australia, New Zealand and Thailand. We are passionate about our team, with safety and inclusivity at the forefront of everything we do. We’re also passionate about our customers, products, and living our values of:

Doing the right thing

Being in it together

Giving a damn

Getting it done




About the role

We are seeking a highly motivated and commercially minded Senior Commercial Analyst to join our AEG team. Acting as 2IC to the Commercial Manager, this role will partner with business leaders across 45 sites, oversee two Commercial Analysts, and provide financial insights that shape strategic decisions.

This is a hands-on, high-impact role offering exposure across commercial finance, operational leadership, and strategic planning in a fast-growing, market-leading business.

What you’ll do

Partner with General Managers, Regional Managers, and Branch Managers to provide financial insights and drive performance.

Lead financial planning processes including budgets, rolling forecasts, and scenario analysis.

Deliver monthly P&L reviews, margin analysis, and variance reporting, providing clear insights to stakeholders.

Support strategic projects including pricing, capital investment business cases, and post-implementation reviews.

Oversee month-end activities, balance sheet reconciliations, and statutory reporting for the Business Unit.

Drive improvements in financial processes, automation, and business intelligence reporting.

Mentor and develop junior team members while building financial capability across the wider business.




What you bring

CA/CPA qualified with tertiary qualifications in Accounting, Finance, or related discipline.

Minimum 5 years’ experience in commercial finance, FP&A, or management accounting in a complex business.

Strong technical accounting knowledge combined with commercial acumen.

Advanced Excel and financial modelling skills; ERP experience (Pronto ideal but not essential).

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to simplify complex information.

A collaborative mindset with proven ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.




Why join Bapcor?

At Bapcor, we value our employees and offer a supportive environment for professional growth. You will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact while working with a dedicated team. Additionally, we offer:

Opportunity to join an Australian owned, ASX listed company and work with an iconic brand.

Asia Pacific’s leading provider of vehicle parts, accessories, equipment, service and solutions.

Opportunity to make a genuine impact in a growing organisation.

Potential for career growth and personal development.

Exclusive discounts and benefits across our Burson Auto Parts trade stores as well as our retail stores including Autobarn, Opposite Lock, Midas Australia, and ABS Service Centres.

Industry Leading Paid Parental Leave & Employee Assistance Program.




Bapcor embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion as integral components of our organisational culture. We recognise that diverse perspectives and experiences contribute to innovation and better decision-making, and we strive to provide a recruitment experience that’s fair, inclusive, and accessible. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures, abilities, backgrounds, sexual orientation and gender identities.




No Recruitment Agencies Please!

While we understand that recruitment agencies would love to offer their support, we kindly request all agencies to refrain from contacting us regarding this job posting. All applications should be submitted directly by candidates.

At RACQ, we’re good people doing good things, making a positive impact every day, with opportunities to learn, grow, and be more.

About the role

RACQ is seeking a dedicated professional to guide and support the operational implementation of our Data Governance Framework within the Insights and Analytics department. This pivotal role will help uplift data stewardship, enhance metadata quality, and strengthen governance capabilities across the organisation. By contributing to the strategic management of RACQ’s data assets, you’ll ensure they are retained, protected, and leveraged in alignment with enterprise standards and regulatory requirements.

Key Responsibilities

Curate and maintain metadata across glossary, catalogue, and lineage views.
Support stewardship workflows and controlled metadata changes.
Assist in documenting governance processes and tool usage procedures.
Produce dashboards and reports for governance committees and management.
Provide front-line support for business users of RACQ’s data governance tools (e.g., Purview, Kada K).

About you

You have a solid understanding of metadata, taxonomy, and data classification principles.
You bring experience in supporting metadata management and data governance practices within complex environments.
You're familiar with data governance tools and metadata standards, and comfortable navigating platforms like Microsoft Purview or Kada K.
You can develop clear, user-friendly training materials and deliver engaging sessions to diverse audiences.
You are detail-oriented, with excellent organisational and documentation skills that support effective governance operations.

Why join RACQ?

It is an exciting time to be part of RACQ as we continue our transformation towards better, smarter solutions that deliver more security and prosperity for Queenslanders. We are big enough to make a real difference in our community, yet small enough to nurture your professional and personal development.

By joining RACQ, you’ll be part of new sustainability initiatives, including a commitment to being a carbon neutral organisation by 2032. We’ve invested in and partnered with sustainable companies, including the introduction home solar and batteries, Green Home and Car Loans, and many other products and initiatives. We’ll continue to advocate for, research, and offer green solutions.

RACQ is committed to ensuring that every employee has access to flexibility in their role. We encourage all candidates to discuss what flexibility means to you, and how we can help you find your balance.

At RACQ we are passionate about building a diverse and inclusive workplace to create better outcomes for our employees and our members. We aim for our teams to be a true reflection of our communities and are committed to inclusion particularly people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, and those who may experience diversity or disability related barriers in securing employment. Applicants from these and other diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply. If you have any support or access requirement, please advise us at the time of applying.

What we offer you:

Our employee benefits are designed to enrich your work life, your home and the community you live in, some of these include:

Financial benefits and discounts on a range of banking, assistance and insurance products
Give back to our communities with paid volunteer leave, payroll giving and volunteering for community events such as MotorFest.
A range of flexible working and leave options, parental leave of 16 weeks primary carer leave, purchased leave up to 4 weeks per year, cultural observance leave, substitution of public holidays for cultural/religious reasons, personal leave for wellbeing, gender affirmation leave.
Prioritise your wellbeing with discounts on health programs and access to wellbeing initiatives such annual flu vaccinations, corporate health insurance offer and free and confidential Employee Assistance Program (EAP). 
Invest in your development with in-house development programs and access to an extensive digital learning platform.

You can check out all our employee benefits at https://www.racq.com.au/about-us/careers/employee-benefits

Ready to apply to do good stuff daily?

Questions or require any adjustments? Please contact careers@racq.com.au or visit www.racq.com.au/about/careers/our-recruitment-process

Please Note: to objectively and comprehensively assess your potential and suitability for the role, RACQ may require you to complete psychometric assessments and/or background checks (which may include working rights, professional references, employment history, qualification/education, professional membership, criminal history, credit, bankruptcy, watch list, politically exposed person, ASIC financial register, directorship and driving history checks) as part of the application process. Want to know exactly which background checks are needed for this role? Reach out to Human Resources at HR@racq.com.au.

#LI-Hybrid

DMC is thrilled to be partnering with a leading energy company in their search for a Project Commercial Analyst to join their team. This role will be supporting on one of the most significant energy infrastructure developments designed to  improve energy security and support renewable integration.

This is a hands-on analytical and partnering role and would be great fit for someone who enjoys making sense of large, complex data sets and turning financial insights into clear, defensible narratives. 
  
This is an initial 3-4 month contract role that would suit candidates who are immediately available or available on short notice. Considering the size and complexity of this project, there may be an opportunity to extend. 
  
Key Responsibilities:
- Analyse and reconcile large volumes of historical cost data against allowances.
- Build models to match actual costs to approved allowances (e.g. labour, biodiversity, community engagement, third-party spend).
- Identify and explain variances — whether driven by volume, value, or scope changes.
- Partner with various internal and external stakeholders (Finance, HR, Procurement teams) to validate data and gather supporting documentation.
- Contribute to improving how financial data is stored, structured, and reported.

About you: 
- Strong analytical skills with experience handling large data sets.
- Proficiency in Excel and data modelling (advanced macros not required).
- Experience in commercial, financial, or regulatory analysis
- Excellent communication skills - able to translate complex financial analysis into clear business narratives.
- A collaborative, inquisitive mindset - willing to challenge data and assumptions constructively.

Job Title: Business Intelligence & Reporting Manager - Azure / Fabric
Ad Text:
The Company:
An established Not-for-Profit headquartered in Sydney is looking for a hands-on Business Intelligence & Reporting Manager to manage a small BI team and to work closely with the business stakeholders & team to deliver innovative Business Intelligence solutions. You must be based in Sydney and be able to work in the office 3 days per week. 

The Role:
This is a 50-50 technical BI & Reporting development & people management role and entails overseeing the delivery and maintenance of the organisation's business intelligence reporting. Critical to this role is the ability to work closely with various business & operational teams to gather BI requirements and then translate into intuitive reports and dashboards.

Key Focus areas:

Proven ability to lead and inspire a team of BI developers and data professionals to deliver high-quality reporting solutions 
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into robust and scalable BI solutions (end-to-end)
Deep knowledge & proven hands-on expertise in data warehousing and BI Reporting Best Practices
Design data models to ensure optimisation of BI reports
Perform data profiling, data cleansing and data validation activities to ensure strong data quality and integrity in the data warehouse
Design and develop interactive reports and visualisations that convey complex business information in a clear and concise way
Your Skillset:

Relevant Degree in Computer Science, Data, Business Intelligence or related field (certifications highly regarded)
10+ years experience in BI & Reporting development (end-to-end), with a minimum of 2 years in a data managerial or leadership role (Azure stack).
Passion for being hands-on, designing and building scalable full-stack reporting solutions whilst providing team leadership and guidance
Strong ability to consult with business users to understand issues from a business lens and translate into technical solutions
Strong dimensional modeling & data warehousing skills
Proven hands-on in MS Fabric & Power BI
Use of AI to enhance BI solutions 
Commitment to building a team culture of innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement
Prior experience within an NFP desirable
You must be a Permanent Resident of Australia or hold Australian Citizenship to be considered for this role.

Please hit apply below for immediate consideration.

We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to join a corporate reporting and analytics team within a leading Australian financial services organisation. This is an exciting opportunity to shape the future of enterprise reporting, automation, and AI integration across key business functions.

About the Role
As the Product Manager – Data, Reporting & AI, you’ll enhance reporting and insights capabilities across Property, Procurement, and Supplier Risk functions. You’ll own the reporting roadmap, automate manual workflows, and uplift dashboards and tools, with a focus on Power BI optimisation, cloud migration, and AI-enabled reporting. You’ll work within a collaborative team of data engineers and reporting specialists, engaging with senior stakeholders to deliver solutions that improve decision-making and self-service analytics.

Key Responsibilities
• Lead and deliver the reporting roadmap across corporate functions.
• Automate manual workflows and streamline data integration.
• Drive Power BI cloud migration and dashboard improvements.
• Explore AI use cases, including Copilot and AI-enabled reporting.
• Enhance user experience and self-service capabilities.
• Engage and influence senior stakeholders to align reporting priorities.

About You
You are a hands-on Product Manager with a strong understanding of data, analytics, and product delivery. You’re proactive, outcome-focused, and comfortable working with both technical teams and senior leaders.
Must-have:
• Advanced Power BI expertise.
• Experience working with data from multiple sources and APIs.
• Background in large corporate or financial services environments.
• Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills.

Nice to have:
• Exposure to AI tools and automation.
• Knowledge of Procurement, Supplier Risk, or Property domains.
• API integration experience.

For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Nic Gulliver at nic.gulliver@peoplebank.com.au quoting reference 268428.

Category:
Clinical/Medical Research (Healthcare & Medical)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
At Ambulance Victoria (AV) we are proud to share our commitment to save and improve lives by providing outstanding care for our patients. This is our promise to every patient, and it sits at the heart of everything we do. No matter what corporate or support role you play in delivering our critical services to Victorians, you will join a team dedicated to bringing our vision to be a world leading ambulance service to life.

We are seeking a Senior Evaluation Analyst to provide Strategic Delivery for our Centre for Research and Evaluation.

This is a Full Time, Permanent position. While WFH/Hybrid options are available, it is essential that the successful applicant maintains a presence at Blackburn North in line with our hybrid working model.

About the role

Reporting to the Director Research and Evaluation, responsibilities of this position include, but not limited to:

Undertake complex analysis, design, monitoring, and evaluation of a range of AV programs and initiatives and provide analytical support to projects within the Centre for Research and Evaluation
Design and implement data collection tools to aid the successful implementation of large and complex evaluation projects
Develop comprehensive evaluation frameworks for key AV projects including program logic maps
Undertake data collection and analysis for evaluation projects, including developing data reports to assist in the monitoring of AV performance using a range of AV and hospital data sources
Foster continuous improvement by researching best practices, evaluating emerging trends and identifying and responding to strategic issues impacting patient care

About you

To be considered for this position you will possess a postgraduate degree in relevant discipline (Public Health, Evaluation, Epidemiology, Mathematics/Statistics, Science, or Research) or relevant industry certification (or progress toward) with high level relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of training and sound experience. Other requirements include:

Previous experience working within the Health Sector (desirable)
Proven experience in scoping evaluation projects and ability to translate project briefs into analysis task
Experience in developing evaluation frameworks and comprehensive project monitoring plans, including developing key performance indicators
Experience in preparing complex Evaluation Frameworks and Program Logic maps and reports for senior management
Advanced user of relevant software applications including statistical software packages (e.g. Microsoft Office suite, STATA, SPSS, Power BI etc.)

Working at Ambulance Victoria

As a valued member of AV you will enjoy a professional working environment that recognises the importance of work/life balance. We offer salary packaging options, generous personal leave entitlements, accrued days off for full time roles, and other benefits including free on-site parking.

We believe our people are our greatest resource and the sustainability of our workforce depends on how well we utilise our people's skills and abilities and whether our staffing reflects the diversity of the Victorian community.  If you are ready to be an integral part in bringing our values of Care, Accountability, Respect and Excellence to life at AV, we want to hear from you!

Important information

By applying for a position, you agree to undertake an assessment of any Secondary Employment or outside interests, in line with AV's Secondary Employment procedure. This is required to ensure there is no perceived or actual conflict of interest for AV should you be successful and commence in the role.

Successful applicants will need to be willing to complete pre-employment screening including references, misconduct and Police Checks.

This position is classified AV5 under the Ambulance Victoria (Management and Administrative Staff) Enterprise Agreement 2021

The position description can be found on the AV Careers website https://careers.ambulance.vic.gov.au.

How to apply

Your application is an integral part of the selection process and should include: 

Cover letter outlining your experience and interest in the position
Current resume
A separate document addressing the key selection criteria from the position description

Applications must be submitted by 11.59pm (AEDT) on Monday 27 October. Applications must be submitted via the AV Careers Centre website https://careers.ambulance.vic.gov.au to be considered. Emailed applications will not be accepted.

 

For further information, please refer to ‘Applying for a position with Ambulance Victoria‘. For any further queries please contact recruitment via recruitment@ambulance.vic.gov.au or 03 9840 3653.

At all levels of our organisation a diverse and inclusive workforce allows us to deliver the Best Care to the Victorian community, and helps create a healthier, more productive workplace for our people. In the event you require a reasonable adjustment to support your application for this role, please contact us at recruitment@ambulance.vic.gov.au and a member of our Recruitment & Selection team will be in touch.

This is: the job
We’re seeking an experienced SAP Training Lead to drive end-to-end learning delivery across a large-scale SAP S/4Hana Transformation Program.

Starting in November 2025, this role will oversee the full training lifecycle — from needs analysis and capability planning through to design, delivery, and post go-live adoption. You’ll collaborate with SMEs, Change Managers, and Functional Analysts to ensure training outcomes are aligned to project goals and business readiness milestones.

This is: what you’ll do
Lead all phases of training delivery — planning, design, execution, and measurement
Conduct Training Needs Analysis and develop comprehensive capability plans
Design structured training solutions using multiple learning pathways and formats
Oversee development of training materials, collateral, and documentation
Manage delivery of instructor-led, online, and on-demand learning solutions
Partner with change teams and SMEs to align training with project milestones
Report on progress, adoption and learning effectiveness to senior stakeholders
Drive training adoption and refresher programs pre- and post-go-live

This is: what you’ll need
Minimum 8 years of SAP project experience in training and enablement roles
Proven experience leading training design and deployment across SAP transformations
Strong knowledge of SAP, with exposure to SuccessFactors Learning and SAP Enable Now (preferred)
Expertise in Training Needs Analysis, capability planning and performance measurement
Demonstrated experience developing multi-format learning programs
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills across change, project, and business teams
Experience coaching senior leaders and project teams in adult learning practices

This is: the perks
Key training leadership role in a major transformation program
Opportunity to shape and deliver capability uplift at enterprise scale
Work with senior stakeholders across change, HR and IT functions
Long-term engagement through full training lifecycle

This is: for good.
Apply with purpose. Be part of a placement that gives back. For every role we fill, we donate to a charity of the client’s choice. We’re closing in on $1 million donated and we’re just getting started.

This is: what’s next
Apply now or reach out to:
Elton Kelly
Principal Consultant, Natural Selection Group
M: 0405 294 375
E: elton.kelly@naturalselectiongroup.com.au

This position has the option to be based in Sydney or Melbourne and offers a hybrid working environment.

Unfortunately, due to this position being within a government entity, only candidates with existing Australian Citizenship are eligible.

Join this prestigious government institution in a specialist capacity to identify vulnerabilities and assess the resilience of the financial system as it pertains to Stress Testing. This position has a particular focus on the banking industry and is responsible for the Analytics that drives the policy decisions of the supervisory entity.

Responsibilities:

Research relevant and emerging Risks that may affect the banking industry and broader Financial System
Contribute to the continuous improvement of Stress Testing methodologies and processes
Advise key internal stakeholders on Stress Testing through analysis of systematic risks and macroprudential policy, to assist in guiding supervisory assessments
Partake in the development, process and delivery of Stress Test results through engaging with the industry
Construct reports for internal and external stakeholders
Requirements:

At least 2 years' experience within Risk Analytics with exposure to a Financial Risk domain such as Stress Testing, Credit Risk, Market Risk, Liquidity or equivalent
Previous exposure to at least one programming language such as R, SAS, Python, Power BI or equivalent (advantageous)

For further information about this position, please contact Olivia on 0409 356 856, email your CV to Olivia@BluefinResources.com.au or simply click APPLY.

Join an expanding software company that is growing around the globe
Inclusive and progressive culture with a hybrid working arrangement
This is a newly created position in Sydney due to growth 
About the company

Our client provides equipment and rental management software in a fully integrated ERP solution. Over the last 35 years, they have become the preferred true ERP software for companies that are serious about profit and evolving with technology. The fully integrated suite of modules includes Sales, Rentals, Service, Parts, and Financials plus helpful tools like CRM software.

From humble beginnings to becoming one of the world’s leading rental software companies is due to their tenacity to take on any challenge. Gaining business mainly through word of mouth and referral, they have grown their reputation for developing customised operations management software that manages the operations of businesses rather than just the invoicing.

About the role

The successful candidate will be responsible for end-to-end implementation and support of ERP solutions - design, business process review, system build, training, and post-implementation support.

Duties

Reporting to the Director of Customer Operations, the role is focussed on supporting and guiding clients through end to end implementations, which can typically take from 12- 18 months. You will be responsible for functional
specifications, system configuration, solution testing, and ensuring successful user experiences.

Acceptance testing, end-user training, and support
Business Process Review with prospects and customers
Requirements gathering and documentation with customers for modification development
Providing training to both customers and internal team members 
Perform data validation and reconciliation with the data conversion team and customers
Working with the Project Manager to deliver projects within scope, on time, and within budget 
Achieve productivity, customer satisfaction and billable KPI’s
Skills & Experience

The idea candidate will have a track record of implementing ERP solutions from the vendor side, with commercial experience and a strong business process understanding. 

Tertiary qualification in a business-related field (accounting/commerce) preferred
Strong knowledge of financials within ERP products 
Previous experience producing specifications for modifications for ERP systems
Client-facing ERP implementation experience
Experience with BI solutions such as Power BI, associated data analysis, SQL, and data warehousing
Culture

Their culture is supportive, inclusive and progressive. Many members of the team have been with the company for more than 10 years, which speaks volumes about the business. 
They always look to promote internally before taking any new roles to market which provides excellent career progression opportunities for their team. 

Benefits

On offer is a generous salary, depending on experience, which reflects the seniority of this position. This is a new position based in Thornleigh in Sydney and the Professional Services Team work from home three out of five days per week.

How to apply

Click APPLY to submit your application. For a confidential discussion, contact Jesse Herrick on 0421 713 236 or email jesse@calidusgroup.com.au

SAP S4Hana Functional Consultant, is required to play a key role in designing and implementing S4HANA-based solutions, as part of a larger IT transformation program.
You will be required to perform the following:

Conduct workshops to gather functional requirements for HANA-based solutions and translate business needs into data models and functional design documents.
Design business-aligned solutions using SAP S/4HANA embedded analytics, including calculation views, CDS views, and logical data models that meet business reporting and analytical requirements.
Collaborate with technical consultants and developers to ensure alignment between functional and technical design.
Configure and validate S/4 HANA data models (analytical, attribute, and calculation views) based on user stories or requirements.
Ensure optimal performance, reusability, and accuracy of data models, aligned with SAP S/4 HANA best practices and governance standards.
Work with business intelligence/reporting teams to deliver HANA-powered reports using SAP Fiori, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), or other front-end tools.
Develop functional specifications for dashboards and KPI reports and embedded analytics within S/4HANA for operational and strategic decision-making.
Develop functional test cases and validate S/4 HANA models and outputs against business scenarios.
Participate in system integration testing (SIT) and user acceptance testing (UAT), Data Migration Testing, Production Verification Testing (PVT) and Business Verification Testing (BVT).
Support defect resolution and ensure reporting outputs are consistent and reliable.
Ensure smooth integration of HANA data models with front-end tools and external systems.
Collaborate with technical consultants, developers, SAP ERP, and middleware teams to align functional and technical design and ensure proper data flow and interface integration.
Provide knowledge transfer, training, and support to business users on accessing and interpreting HANA based reports.
Prepare functional and technical documentation (e.g. Functional and Technical Specifications), user guides, and metadata catalogs.
Identify performance issues in data models or reports and work with technical teams to tune queries and improve system efficiency.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.
Act as the functional bridge between business users and SAP HANA technical teams.
Provide regular updates to stakeholders on delivery progress, risks, resolution plans and contribute to governance forums and solution design reviews.
Stay updated on SAP HANA innovations, tools, and upgrades (e.g., SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake, etc.).
Recommend new use cases and analytics capabilities to leverage SAP HANA's full potential.

To be successful in this position you must be a highly experienced Functional Consultant who has solid experience in SAP Hana Grow and Rise Functional design and implementation. You will also be able to translate complex business requirements into efficient and scalable HANA data models. Strong understanding of Business Processes and Analytical Requirements including SAP Signavio processes is also a requirement. Excellent analytical and communication skills are a must

Apply using the link or email Leonie.woodfine@randstad.com.au


At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Shine Solutions, established in 1998, is an Australian IT consultancy and software development services provider that uses cutting-edge technologies and expertise to create practical, innovative technology solutions. While technology is our craft, our core focus is always on people – our clients and our team. We are a privately owned company with a dedicated team of over 160 consultants and engineers based across Melbourne, Sydney and Canberra.




When you work at Shine, you will work with a team that:

Loves sharing experiences and learning from each other 

Is deeply passionate about all things technology

Supports flexible working arrangements 

Encourages further learning opportunities 

Challenges you – and encourages you to excel



The Role

We are seeking an experienced and proactive Senior Business Analyst to bridge the gap between our business stakeholders and technical teams for critical AWS infrastructure projects. You will be responsible for understanding business needs, eliciting and documenting requirements and ensuring that our AWS solutions effectively support our strategic objectives, enhance operational efficiency and optimize costs.



You'll work closely with Product Owners, Cloud Architects, DevOps Engineers, Security Teams and business unit leaders to define project scope, analyze requirements, and facilitate the delivery of robust and scalable AWS infrastructure solutions.



You MUST be an Australian Citizen with minimum Baseline security clearance. NV1 or higher security clearance will be highly regarded.



Required Skills & Experience:

Proficiency in industry best-practice business analysis techniques (e.g., requirements elicitation, process modeling, use case development, user story writing, acceptance criteria definition).

Proven ability to solve complex business and technical problems, lead sophisticated process modeling (as-is, to-be), conduct thorough user needs analysis, and drive impactful process improvements.

Experience leading others in complex problem-solving and business analysis processes.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure or GCP) and the ability to apply their services to solve business problems.

Ability to collaborate with Cloud Engineers to translate business requirements into technical specifications and solution designs.

Expertise in managing scope and scope changes across a backlog, with a keen awareness of the impact of any changes on project timelines and budget.

Experience working effectively within Agile/Scrum methodologies and using tools like Jira and Confluence.

Ability to deliver clear, well-structured and concise arguments to support opinions and recommendations.

Strong facilitation skills, capable of guiding diverse teams (technical, business, leadership) to consensus on scope, design and implementation decisions for AWS projects.

Ability to build trust quickly and foster positive, influential relationships with client stakeholders, internal teams and partner stakeholders, leading these relationships where appropriate.



Why Shine? 

We put people first. And it pays off. 



At Shine, Integrity is more than just a platitude. It’s ingrained in all that we do - from our carbon neutral footprint, to our philanthropic activities to conducting regular reviews of our actions to ensure that we foster a diverse and inclusive workplace.



We value diversity, equity and inclusion at Shine. We believe that creating a diverse team, which includes individuals from different backgrounds and with varying experiences, skills, and perspectives, will drive innovation, creativity and success.



We’ve created a working environment that respects and nurtures technologists. Our staff engagement rates are significantly higher than industry averages. Our average tenure is also longer. And our staff turnover is lower.



In fact, our engagement rate of 88% places Shine in the top 10% of Professional Services Organizations globally. 



How do we do it? By putting you first – always. 



What else can you expect? 

On top of our one-of-a-kind culture, you’ll also enjoy some tangible perks like: 

Funding for approved training programs and certifications, such as AWS and GCP.

Pre-approved up to $250 per year on reference books or self-paced training materials of your choice.

Access to online training modules to keep abreast of the latest technologies.

Financial incentives to share your expertise on our blog, at team forums and industry events.

Lifestyle leave - you can buy extra annual leave each year, out of pre tax income.

Access to an EAP (Employee Assistance Program) for confidential counseling sessions. 

If you’re looking to work for leaders in technology solutions who put people first, you’ve found a match!!

Business Analyst is currently required for a 2 year fixed term assignment with a strong focus on Human Capital Management (HCM) to join a significant IT transformation program. In this pivotal role, you will be instrumental in ensuring HCM systems compliance and supporting HCM projects within the IT transformation program. You will be responsible for translating complex business requirements into effective system configurations, driving enhancements across HCM systems and business processes, and ensuring strict adherence to HCM regulations.

Key Responsibilities:
Conduct thorough analysis of existing HCM processes, systems, and data flows.
Assist with the planning and strategic direction of HCM-related projects.
Identify opportunities to improve efficiency, accuracy, and compliance within HCM operations.
Gather and document detailed business requirements from diverse stakeholders across various departments.
Ensure all HCM systems align with regulatory requirements and organizational policies.
Effectively translate business requirements into technical requirements, including functional and non-functional user stories.
Facilitate workshops, conduct one-on-one interviews, perform process mapping, and utilize other methods, including developing user stories, with a likely focus on Agile sprint cycles.
Liaise with vendors and the delivery team to ensure alignment between technical and functional specifications.
Work closely with the HCM Delivery Lead to ensure system configuration meets business-as-usual (BAU) requirements.
Develop comprehensive business process documentation.
Ensure clear and effective communication between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Identify potential project risks and issues, and collaborate to develop and execute mitigation plans.
Plan and coordinate testing efforts, including User Acceptance Testing (UAT), to validate that implemented solutions effectively address business needs.
To be successful in this position you will be a highly experienced Business Analyst with proven experience in working on HCM projects. You will be able to determine business processes and requirements within an Agile environment. Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills are a must

Apply today by using the link or email Leonie.woodfine@randstad.com.au


At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

The role

Join Our Talent Community at Auto & General!

 

Are you a curious, driven Business Analyst ready to make a real impact? Whether you're passionate about digital transformation, customer experience, product innovation, operations, or compliance - we want to hear from you!

At Auto & General, we’re continuously growing and evolving. That’s why we’re always on the lookout for talented Business Analysts across multiple divisions, including Claims, Risk & Compliance, Sales and Service, Product, Technology, and more.This is your opportunity to join a high-performing, collaborative BA community working on exciting, strategic projects that directly shape the future of our organisation.

 

Support the planning and delivery of projects.

Analyse existing business processes, systems, and workflows to identify improvements and ensure alignment with project goals.

Elicit, capture, and translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications.

Partner with stakeholders to understand needs, identify opportunities, and define clear business requirements

Analyse current processes, systems, and data to design and deliver improvements

Translate business problems into practical solutions and technical specifications

Support project planning, delivery, and change initiatives

Collaborate with technical teams, project managers, and business leaders across the organisation

Document user stories, workflows, process maps, and test cases

Maintain high standards of documentation using tools like Jira, Confluence, and MS Project


 

What experience you’ll bring

3–5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst 

Experience in any domain: risk, digital, customer, IT, operations, or transformation

Strong analytical, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills

Ability to work independently and collaboratively in cross-functional teams

A curious mindset and a passion for continuous improvement

Experience with Agile and tools like Jira, Confluence, or similar

Proficient skills in business process modelling, As-Is/To-Be process mapping and data models;

Proven track record in supporting complex projects and strategic initiatives.

Familiarity with regulated industries (e.g., insurance, finance, healthcare) is a bonus

Tertiary qualifications in business, IT, or related field 

 

Our Perks 

 

Location : All Sites

We are recruiting for multiple positions across our Brisbane and Sunshine Coast locations. If your application is shortlisted, we will confirm the specific roles and locations available at that time to ensure clarity.

Our Toowong office is close to the city with easy public transport and parking options while our North Lakes offices are w...

HCM Senior Business Analyst – Digital Transformation| Melbourne (Hybrid) 

2 Year Fixed-term Position. 

We’re currently working with a large education-based enterprise embarking on a significant digital transformation program. This organisation is modernising its core systems and processes to enhance employee experience and streamline HR operations across a wide network of sites.

As part of this initiative, they are seeking multiple HCM Business Analysts to support the design and delivery of a new Human Capital Management (HCM) system within the Digital Change and Transformation team.

The Role
Reporting to the Lead HCM Business Analyst, you’ll play a key role in defining and documenting business processes and system requirements to enable the successful implementation of the HCM solution.

Your responsibilities will include:

Conducting detailed analysis of as-is and to-be business processes and data flows
Facilitating workshops to gather and validate business and system requirements
Producing end-to-end process maps using BPMN standards (Visio or Signavio)
Translating business requirements into user stories and functional specifications
About You
You’re an experienced Business Analyst with a strong background in HCM or HRIS projects, ideally gained within a large or complex organisation. You enjoy working across people, process, and technology, and can confidently manage stakeholder engagement in transformation environments.

Key skills and experience:

Proven experience as a Business Analyst on HCM or HRIS implementation projects
Knowledge of HR, Payroll, or Finance processes and compliance requirements
Exposure to systems such as SAP, Oracle, Workday, or ADP
Strong process mapping skills using BPMN
Background in the education or public sector is highly regarded
What’s on Offer
Join a high-impact digital transformation program
Collaborative, purpose-driven work culture
Flexible hybrid work model (2 days in office - East Melbourne)
Salary $140k to $160k base plus Super (depending on experience)
Apply now with a relevant CV and/or Cover Letter highlighting your HCM experience. 

Please note that we can only speak to shortlisted candidates. 

If you have any questions, it's best to email on: Emma.Beale@PRA.com.au

Role Focus We are seeking an experienced Credit Risk Data Scientist / Modeller to join a high-impact team delivering end-to-end credit risk solutions. The successful candidate will work on credit risk models, supporting risk frameworks and providing actionable insights to internal and external stakeholders.

This role is ideal for candidates who enjoy working on complex credit risk projects, developing models from data exploration through deployment and monitoring, while ensuring robust governance and regulatory compliance.
Core Responsibilities

Develop and maintain credit risk scorecard models (application, behavioural, collections).
Build and validate models using probability of default
Execute end-to-end model development: feature engineering, model build, validation, performance monitoring, and portfolio reporting.
Ensure data and model governance compliance, working with internal and external stakeholders including risk, operations, regulators, and bureaus.
Provide technical expertise and guidance on model design, monitoring, and optimisation.
Technical Skills

Python: XGBoost, scikit-learn, pandas, numpy
SQL: Advanced querying and data manipulation
AWS or GCP understanding a plus!
Strong understanding of credit risk frameworks and regulatory requirements
Experience with model validation, monitoring, and reporting frameworks
About you 

5–8+ years’ experience in credit risk modelling or analytics within banking, financial services
Exposure to Utilities or Telco is also condisered
Comfortable engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Able to manage multiple concurrent projects and deliver high-quality outputs

Company Description

About SEEK

At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and to help organisations succeed.

By joining us, you’ll be part of a multi-national technology business that is far-reaching with a start-up working culture that focuses on a set of collaborative values and appreciates dynamic cultures. SEEK is a place where potential meets possibility – it’s where your career aspiration and our purpose can make great things happen.

Why join us?

Be part of a multi-national tech company with strong core values to help us solve complex challenges for our customers while building a flexible, exciting career – one that could take you anywhere.

We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment. As one of Asia Pacific’s largest tech companies, you’ll contribute to multi-lingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region.

Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team. Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences and courses while you work alongside seasoned experts.

Job Description

The Role

The Data Solution Designer is a vital part of the Data Services team, who provide trustworthy and safe to use data assets for SEEK teams across APAC, so that they can make informed decisions and deliver customer experiences using data.

Reporting directly to the Engineering Manager, the Data Solution Designer is responsible for designing data assets and ensuring they meet the needs of our internal partners and the business.

In this role you will have a dual focus technical data modelling/crafting data products and business analysis/eliciting requirements.  

Key Responsibilities

Liaise with data users across the business to understand their data needs
Design data assets that could serve business objectives and support core metrics
Build prototype of the target data model and test the prototype
Work with Data Engineers to implement data assets, QA the results, and facilitate acceptance testing
Develop the detailed mapping document and other training documentation
Work with teams who provide data to specify what is to be collected and ensure quality is fit for purpose
Provide training and support for data consumers 
Qualifications

Essential Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Understanding needs of customers, capturing requirements, planning and designing solutions
Able to collaborate and communicate closely with all internal and external partners/customer.
Abilities to determine prerequisites for a data model, and create and work with conceptual, logical, and physical data models
Deep understanding of data warehousing, business intelligence, data management, data quality, and ETL
Experience supporting business intelligence, analytics and data science
Data/Dimensional modelling with an eye to usability and performance  
Additional Information

Permanent Perks

At SEEK we offer:

Flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
Casual dress every day

At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.

We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us. Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.

For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.

SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Job Title: Sales & Finance Reporting and Analytics Coordinator
Ad Text:
At Hays Enterprise Solutions, our mission is to help organisations thrive by supporting their workforce needs. We partner with over thirty large organisations across Australia and New Zealand providing tailored solutions to ensure our clients have unrivalled access to top talent and unique market insights to build their evolving workforces.

This is a 12mth position within an automotive institution

What you’ll contribute to
As a Sales & Finance Reporting & Analytics Coordinator, you will be primarily responsible for contributing to National Sales administration for dealer payments, analysis, maintaining and implementing policies, plans and objectives that strengthen Sales Operational Support activities and align to the overall profitability of the company.

How you'll make an impact

Manage inbox items engaging relevant stakeholders to ensure a timely
response. Develop tracking, reporting systems and analyse results to drive kaizen
activity.

Implements and reviews agreed National Sales systems, processes and procedures
consistent with set policies in order to achieve National Sales objectives.

Governance of key National Sales policies such as Vehicle Sales Policy and Fleet Master Pricing Agreement. Ensure compliance and robust processes are implemented.

Updates and maintains reporting systems in order to provide the business with
accurate and timely information to support planning, budgeting and forecasting
activities.

Monitors and analyses performance against targets for own area and recommends
countermeasures where required in order to ensure that agreed objectives can be
achieved.

Monitors own tasks with respect to compliance with all relevant regulations and
statutory requirements in order to minimise the companies risk exposure and liabilities. 

Required Skills

Degree Qualification in Finance or Accounting.

5+ years’ accumulative experience.

Extensive experience with MS Excel & SAP.

Experience automating tasks utilising Excel.

Extensive experience in reporting and analytics.

Experience presenting insights and reports to senior stakeholders.

We look forward to hearing from you!

What’s on Offer
High-visibility role reporting directly to divisional leadership with exposure to executive decision-making.
The chance to act as a key lead for a $1bn+ division.
Flexible working arrangements – work split across Sydney CBD and Western Sydney sites, with occasional interstate travel.
Join a well-established Australian organisation with over 100 years of history and a strong focus on sustainability and the circular economy.
Be part of a business that is investing in growth, performance, and transformation – offering scope to make a genuine impact.
The Opportunity
An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Finance Manager – Commercial to join a large and established Australian industrial and manufacturing organisation. This is a pivotal role within the finance leadership team, taking on full P&L accountability for a $1bn+ division and directly managing a team of four highly experienced State Analysts located nationally.
Reporting to the Divisional Finance Lead, this role will work closely with site managers, traders, and the executive team to drive financial performance, improve decision-making, and support the ongoing transformation of the business.


Key Responsibilities
Lead and develop a high-performing team of four state-based finance analysts who partner closely with site leadership
Full P&L ownership for a complex national division, ensuring accurate reporting, forecasting and business insights
Partner with state managers and senior executives to influence strategy and performance outcomes
Manage cashflow, working capital, and commercial governance, including exposure to hedging and FX for international sales
Oversee the monthly management cycle and reporting requirements, ensuring accuracy and insight
Play a key role in business improvement initiatives, identifying opportunities to streamline processes and improve efficiency across finance and operations
Support ongoing transformation projects and contribute to strategic initiatives to strengthen long-term performance
About You
To succeed in this role, you will be a senior finance professional who combines strong technical foundations with commercial leadership experience. You will have the confidence and gravitas to influence senior stakeholders and lead an experienced team while maintaining a hands-on, business-focused approach.
CA/CPA qualified (or equivalent).
Proven background in commercial or operational finance in heavy industry, manufacturing, or industrial environments (essential). 
Strong track record of P&L management and business partnering with senior leadership.
Demonstrated leadership skills, with the ability to coach, influence and engage a long-tenured and geographically dispersed team.
Strong analytical and critical thinking capability, with an appetite for change and continuous improvement.
Excellent communication skills and ability to build relationships across multiple states and sites.
How to Apply

If you are a commercially focused finance leader seeking a broad, challenging, and rewarding role where you can influence at the highest level, please submit your CV via the link below. All applications will be treated in strict confidence.

Category:
Compliance & Risk (Banking & Financial Services)
Government - Federal (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Hybrid work environment
Full-time/Permanent
Play an important part shaping the future of our iconic Australian institution


About the role


We are seeking a Lead Analyst, Operational Risk and Resilience to join the Business Risk Oversight team within Risk Management. This is a Line 2 role supporting the uplift of the Bank's operational risk and resilience practices. This role is ideal for someone who is eager to learn, contribute to meaningful work, and grow within a high-performing team.


You will work closely with departments across the Bank to strengthen operational risk management, provide independent oversight and assist with risk assessments, reporting, control reviews, and stakeholder coordination. You will also contribute to the development of frameworks and tools that support continuity of operations and effective third-party risk management


Key Responsibilities


Support the development and implementation of the Bank's operational risk and resilience frameworks.
Provide Line 2 oversight of risk and control assessments, including business continuity, incident response, and third-party risk.
Support the preparation of risk reports, dashboards, and governance materials.
Maintain and update risk registers, control libraries, and action plans.
Help coordinate responses to internal audits, regulatory reviews, and assurance activities.
Monitor key risk indicators (KRIs) and emerging risk trends.
Collaborate with Line 1 stakeholders to embed operational risk management.
Contribute to continuous improvement of risk processes, templates, and tools.



About you


7+ years' experience in operational risk, business continuity or a related discipline, ideally within financial services or a regulatory environment.
Strong understanding of risk management frameworks (e.g. ISO 31000) and regulatory expectations (e.g. CPS 220, CPS 234, CPS 230).
Experience working in or with large, complex organisations undergoing risk transformation is advantageous.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate risks into business impacts.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate across functions.
Familiarity with GRC tools and risk reporting platforms is advantageous.
Relevant tertiary qualifications in risk, finance, economics, compliance, or a related discipline



About the team


Reporting to the Senior Manager, Operational Risk and Resilience within the Risk Management and Compliance team (Line 2), you will play a leading role in establishing effective Line 2 review, challenge, and insight across the Bank's material risk classes. Establishing strategic and trusted relationships across the Bank is fundamental to the team's success.


Be More

Working for an organisation that truly makes a difference to the people of Australia, we can offer development and career opportunities in a collaborative environment that supports your growth, wellbeing and promotes flexibility. Your individual growth and success drives the RBA forward as an organisation. Be more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia.


Why RBA?

The RBA makes an important contribution to the Australian economy through the pursuit of national economic policy objectives and associated activities in financial markets and banking. We also issue Australia's banknotes and operate infrastructure critical to the payments system, all of which contribute to the welfare of the Australian people. Made up of specialists across a wide range of fields, our people, values, and culture play a critical role in achieving our objectives. Striving to be Open & Dynamic, we consider and incorporate different perspectives, work across teams and are transparent with each other, whilst delivering quality together effectively and focusing on outcomes by prioritising, testing, learning, and refining as we go. Our people conduct themselves with a high degree of integrity, while striving for excellence in the work they perform and the outcomes they achieve. We encourage intelligent inquiry and we treat one another with respect while promoting the public interest through our efforts. We know it is the growth and success of our people that drives the RBA forward. Come and make a bigger contribution while you build and develop your own skills too, because being more means you can do more, for yourself and for Australia.

The Reserve Bank of Australia is committed to equity, diversity and inclusion through key initiatives. We welcome and encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse background, those living with a disability and from the LGBTQ+ community. We are committed to making the recruitment process fair and equitable for all our candidates.

Our client
High growth Aussie group. They've got operations nationwide and have shown great expansion across their multiple states. A closely knit and stable team with excellent leadership. 

This role reports and works closely with an experienced CFO.

This role would suit a high achieving Senior Analyst ready to step into their first management role, or an existing Finance Manager.

The role

Business partnering - provide value add analysis and support in addressing profitability opportunities and challenges.
Responsible for annual budget and rolling quarterly forecast
Provide insights and develop tools to support business management to make informed assessments for strategic cost and pricing decisions.
Pricing and margin reviews of various sales channels and promotional product campaigns         
Capital investment reviews for proposed new products and existing product upgrade investments to be submitted for Board approval   
Preparation of papers for board submissions
Manage a small team 

About you

CPA/CA qualified (ideal, non essential)
Experience in a fast paced environment is essential - retail, FMCG, ecommerce, marketing, media, etc.
Strong experience with analysis and financial planing (budget/forecast). Strong financial modelling, use with BI tools, is a plus
At least 2+ years of experience in commercial finance role/s
People management experience desired but non essential
  
 

For more information contact Schenuk Wijesekera on 02 9775 5916 or apply using the "Apply" button.
